footer.tax-disclaimer: Yayasan Sanusiah Al-Mansyuriah Sumedang is an organization registered under the Decision of the Minister of Law and Human Rights of the Republic of Indonesia with the number: AHU-0027215.AH.01.04.Year 2021. <docs>See legal document.</docs>

about-info.title: Our Founder
about-info.name: KH. Ita Zaenal Mutaqien
about-info.desc: The Sanusiah Al-Mansyuriah Foundation in Sumedang was founded by a founder named KH. Ita Zaenal Mutaqien in 2021. This foundation is located in Pangjeleran Hamlet, Rt.03 Rw. 04, Cigintung Village, Cisitu District, Sumedang Regency, West Java, Indonesia. KH. Ita Zaenal Mutaqien is a respected religious scholar and figure, highly regarded by the community in Sumedang and its surrounding areas.

mission.title: Our Vision and Mission
mission.description: The birth of human resources that are religious, scientific, entrepreneurial, internationally-minded, environmentally conscious, and become the beacon of world civilization.
mission.content1: 1. Creating a cool and liberating atmosphere in Islamic boarding school education by providing space for creativity, criticism, entrepreneurship, and international insight.
mission.content2: 2. Implementing an integral curriculum that combines elements of moral and spiritual reinforcement, classical Islamic scholarly traditions, and fundamental competencies of modern international science through a boarding school system. This is achieved through the application of systematic, planned, and controlled educational management.
mission.content3: 3. Expanding the scope of education as an implementation of the saying of the Prophet, 'Learning begins from the cradle and continues until the grave.'

ourProjects.content: Madrasah Diniyah Takmiliyah Awaliyah Hidayatul Mutaqien is a recognized Quranic study program by the Ministry of Religious Affairs.

ourProducts.content: The foundation was established to provide Umrah products for Muslims who wish to perform the Umrah pilgrimage. The Umrah products offered by the foundation include travel packages that encompass various facilities such as accommodation, transportation, and other support services. Understanding the significance of the Umrah pilgrimage in Islamic teachings, the foundation is committed to delivering quality, safe, and comfortable services for its pilgrims. All activities and travel packages are organized with consideration for religious, comfort, and security aspects, allowing pilgrims to perform the Umrah pilgrimage with tranquility and devotion.

ourProjects2.content: GGF is an agricultural and livestock activity that supports the programs of the Sanusiah Al-Mansyuriah Foundation in Sumedang.

ourProjects3.content: Integra Madani is an IT-based tutoring activity.

ourProjects4.content: Service Centre is a lab that supports Integra Madani activities in terms of IT practices.

about-us.title: About us
about-us.description: The Sanusiah Al-Mansuriah Foundation in Sumedang was established with the aim of spreading the teachings of Islam and assisting the community in terms of education and social welfare. The foundation engages in social activities such as providing facilities and infrastructure for students, and more.

what-we-do.title: What do we do?
what-we-do.item-1: Creating a unique, serene, and liberating educational atmosphere in the Islamic boarding school setting for students. We are committed to providing space for creativity, critical thinking, entrepreneurship, and international perspectives, allowing each student to develop their potential holistically.
what-we-do.item-2: We are committed to expanding the scope of education. We believe that the learning process should involve all stages of life; therefore, we offer a comprehensive learning experience from infancy to adulthood, ensuring the holistic development of students in line with the demands of the times.

how-we-help.title: How do we help?
how-we-help.item-1: We provide support by creating an enriching and liberating educational environment within our Islamic boarding school. Our commitment lies in providing space for creativity, critical thinking, entrepreneurship, and international perspectives, empowering every student to fully explore their potential.
how-we-help.item-2: We offer a comprehensive educational journey from infancy to adulthood, meeting the holistic development of students in line with the demands of the contemporary world. Our aim is to shape individuals who are empowered, not only academically but also equipped with the moral and practical skills necessary to thrive in a diverse and interconnected global society.

who-we-are.title: Who we are?
who-we-are.item-1: The Sanusiah Al-Mansyuriah Foundation in Sumedang was established by a founder named KH. Ita Zaenal Mutaqien in 2021. The foundation is located in Dusun Pangjeleran, Rt.03 Rw. 04, Desa Cigintung, Kecamatan Cisitu, Kabupaten Sumedang, West Java, Indonesia. KH. Ita Zaenal Mutaqien is a respected religious scholar and figure in Sumedang and its surrounding communities.

report.title: Report
report.description: The foundation report summarizes the activities and financial condition of a non-profit organization. It consists of financial statements that include income, expenses, balance sheets, and cash flows, as well as an activity report that highlights projects, achievements, and positive impacts.

terms.title: Terms and Conditions
terms.description: Welcome to the website of Sanusiah Al-Mansuriah Foundation Sumedang ('Foundation'). By accessing or using this website, you are deemed to agree to and be bound by the following terms and conditions. If you do not agree with any of these terms, please refrain from continuing to use this site.
terms.foot: By using this website, you agree to comply with and be bound by these terms and conditions. If there are any questions or clarifications needed, please contact Sanusiah Al-Mansuriah Foundation Sumedang through the provided contact information.

sub-1.title: 1. Information and Copyright:
sub-1.point-1: All content, including text, images, and other design elements, is protected by copyright and is the property of Sanusiah Al-Mansuriah Foundation Sumedang unless stated otherwise.
sub-1.point-2: Users are not allowed to download, reproduce, or use material from this site without written permission from the Foundation.

sub-2.title: 2. Vision and Mission:
sub-2.point-1: The Foundation's vision and mission are core guidelines that must be acknowledged by users as the foundation and objectives of the activities and programs organized.

sub-3.title: 3. Data Usage and Privacy:
sub-3.point-1: Student data and other information provided on this site will be respected and kept confidential in accordance with the Foundation's privacy policy.
sub-3.point-2: Users hereby agree to the collection and use of their personal data in accordance with the applicable privacy policy.

sub-4.title: 4. Complaints and Feedback:
sub-4.point-1: Users can submit complaints or provide feedback through the channels provided on this site.
sub-4.point-2: The Foundation is committed to responding to complaints promptly and providing appropriate solutions.

sub-5.title: 5. External Links:
sub-5.point-1: This site may include links to external websites. The Foundation is not responsible for the content or privacy policies of these third-party websites.

sub-6.title: 6. Updates and Changes:
sub-6.point-1: The Foundation reserves the right to update, modify, or delete these terms and conditions without prior notice. Users are expected to check this page periodically.

numbers.title: The Issue in Numbers

1.description: The difficulty in developing potential and innovation arises due to a lack of access to resources, a curriculum that does not sufficiently support creativity, and a lack of stimulation for innovative thinking.

2.description: Lack of support and emotional intelligence.

3.description: Feeling constrained or unfulfilled in the educational environment may lead individuals to seek escape by exploring less constructive or even harmful paths.

numbers.source: Survey of the Sanusiah Al-Mansyuriah Foundation in Sumedang, 2023.

1.description: We hope to provide Improving Resource Access.

2.description: One million free hours of Counseling and Supervision.

3.description: 25 million dollars to Educational Environment Strengthening.

5.description: Over a thousand for Life Skills Training.

6.description: Over 5,000 to learn Emotional Support Development.

1.title: The more you give, the more you save
1.description: Donations to nonprofit foundations are the best way to reduce your tax burden.

2.title: 40 years of experience
2.description: Managing scalable projects with capital applied to generate social impact.

3.title: Transparency
3.description: Our accounts are public, transparent, and audited, within the first quarter of each year.

contact-us.title: Contact Us
contact-us.description: Are you looking for a workshop on sensitivity and best practices for your company, or your child, or do you want to collaborate with us?
contact-us.location: Dsn. Pangjeleran RT/RW 03/04 Ds. Cigintung Cisitu Sumedang

projects.title: Our Project
projects.content: This project is designed to achieve the main goals of the project by integrating a series of interrelated activities. The project involves careful coordination and management to ensure that each activity supports the overall achievement of goals.

products.title: Our Products
products.content: These products are designed to achieve the main goals by integrating a series of interrelated features. These products involve careful coordination and management to ensure that each feature supports the overall achievement of goals.

1.question: What is the purpose of establishing Yayasan Sanusiah Al-Mansuriah Sumedang?
1.answer: This foundation was established to spread the teachings of Islam and assist the community in education and social welfare.

2.question: What social activities does the foundation engage in?
2.answer: The foundation carries out social activities such as providing educational facilities for students and more.

3.question: How is the educational atmosphere at Yayasan Sanusiah Al-Mansuriah Sumedang described?
3.answer: The educational atmosphere at this foundation is described as a unique, refreshing, and liberating Islamic boarding school for students.

4.question: What does 'space for creativity, critical thinking, entrepreneurship, and international perspective' mean?
4.answer: It reflects the foundation's commitment to providing every student with the opportunity to develop their potential holistically.

5.question: How is the curriculum implemented at Yayasan?
5.answer: The curriculum is implemented integrally, encompassing moral and spiritual reinforcement, classical Islamic scholarly traditions, and basic competencies of modern international scientists through a boarding school system.

6.question: How does the foundation support the holistic development of students?
6.answer: The foundation provides support by creating an enriching and liberating educational environment, empowering students to fully explore their potential.

7.question: What is meant by 'expanded scope of education'?
7.answer: It refers to the foundation's belief that the learning process should involve all stages of life, from infancy to adulthood.

8.question: How does the foundation help create religious and entrepreneurial human resources?
8.answer: The foundation creates an educational atmosphere that includes religion, creativity, critical thinking, entrepreneurship, and international perspectives.

9.question: Does the foundation provide financial support for education?
9.answer: Further information can be obtained by directly contacting the foundation.

10.question: Does the foundation accept students from outside the region?
10.answer: Further information about student admission can be obtained through the foundation's registration procedures.

11.question: What role does the boarding school play in curriculum implementation?
11.answer: The boarding school plays a role in implementing systemic, planned, and controlled educational management.

12.question: What is meant by the saying 'Learning begins from the cradle to the grave' by the Prophet?
12.answer: It reflects the foundation's commitment to providing lifelong education, involving all stages of life.

13.question: Does the foundation offer scholarships?
13.answer: Information about scholarship programs can be obtained from the foundation.

14.question: Who is the founder of Yayasan Sanusiah Al-Mansuriah Sumedang?
14.answer: The founder of the foundation is KH. Ita Zaenal Mutaqien.

15.question: Where is the location of the foundation?
15.answer: The foundation is located in Dusun Pangjeleran Rt.03 Rw. 04 Desa Cigintung Kecamatan Cisitu Kabupaten Sumedang, Jawa Barat, Indonesia.
